name: Wave No. 23
description:
Wave No. 23 is the second jumbo piece I have done. 

36 x 86 Oil, Acrylic, Stain on reclaimed wood - White oak slabs  from a barn in Michigan from the 1890's with a Charwood accent piece along the footer from a Kentucky Barn 1880's.

I recently returned from a surf trip to Nicaragua, and I couldn't shake this image from my minds eye. heavy thunderclouds often accented our sessions. The waves in Nicaragua are heavy, hollow and fast. 

This is a huge piece, I've included a few photos from my living room for scale.

Special Shipping Info: 
This is a very large and heavy piece, if you purchase this piece I will contact you separately to make shipping arrangements. Shipping costs are the responsibility of the buyer.

If you live in Santa Barbra, LA, Orange County or San Diego area I will gladly drive this to your home/office and mount it for you.

If you live in San Francisco, I make trips to SF once a month and will happily deliver this to your home/office.

name: Wave No. 22
description:
15 x 36 Acrylic on reclaimed wood, white oak

Wave No. 22 is a meaty right hander painted on a beautiful slab of white oak and Douglas fir on vintage reclaimed wood from a barn in Tennessee dating back to the 1890's.

name: Wave No. 21
description:
28 x 62 Acrylic on reclaimed wood, white oak

Wave No. 21 is painted on reclaimed wood from a barn from early 1800's in Kentucky and is a depiction of  one of the biggest and best days ever surfed at Cloudbreak in Fiji (June 7th 2012).  This is a painting of one of those beasts that rolled through unridden that day.

name: Wave No. 20
description:
I wanted Wave No. 20 to be special, so I created this massive 3' x 6' wood panel from some incredibly beautiful wood. Wave No. 20 is the largest piece I have created to date.

36 x 72 Oil, Acrylic, Stain on reclaimed wood, white oak slabs from a barn in Michigan from the 1890's.  

This wave represents what most surfers hunt for when they head out on a surf trip to a distant tropical location, perfect shape with offshore winds and no one out.  I have heard this wave exists in Nicaragua and I am leaving shortly to find it.

Special Shipping Info:
This is a very large and heavy piece, if you purchase this piece I will contact you separately to make shipping arrangements.  Shipping costs are the responsibility of the buyer.

If you live in Santa Barbra, LA, Orange County or San Diego area I will gladly drive this to your home/office and mount it for you.  

If you live in San Francisco, I make trips to SF once a month and will happily deliver this to your home/office.

name: Wave No. 19
description:
Wave No. 18 was commissioned for an east-coast surfer by his wife. We got the piece to him just in time for his birthday!

24 x 40 Acrylic on reclaimed wood, Red Oak

Wave No. 19 is painted on reclaimed wood from a barn from early 1800's in Kentucky, and depicts Old Mans a famous Southern California surfing spot at San Onofre State Beach (on a fairly sizable day I might add).  The palapa at San O has been there for as long as I can remember, so of course we had to add that tiny detail in the bottom right.  

Price is not disclosed on commissions. I enter price as a penny simply because the cart system I use requires a price to post a product.

name: Wave No. 18
description: Wave No. 18 was a commissioned by Dann Petty for Jon Lax and Geoff Teehan of the founders of the design agency Teehan+Lax 24 x 40 Acrylic on reclaimed wood, white oak Wave No. 18 is painted on reclaimed wood from a barn from early 1800's in Kentucky and is a depiction of Teahupo'o on the famous Code Red day from 2011.

name: Wave No. 17
description:
12 x 12 x 1.5 Acrylic on reclaimed white oak. This wood dates back to the 1880's and is from Michigan.

I love instagram. use it everyday to capture inspiration and moments around me.  I found the perfect piece of vintage reclaimed wood just waiting to be put to good use to create an analog version of a digital experience we take in everyday.

name: Wave No. 16
description:
This piece has been donated to The Waterman's Ball art auction to help raise funds for over 20 environmental organizations.  

13.5 x 40 Acrylic on reclaimed wood, Red Oak 

Wave No.16 is painted on reclaimed wood from an abandoned barn in Tennessee built in the late 1800's.

The red oak has some deep wear and grain patterns from years of growth and exposure to the elements.  Wave No. 16 carefully weaves through the grain to create a close relationship between wave and grain.

name: Wave No. 15
description:
22.5 x 40 Acrylic on reclaimed wood, white oak

The moody wave no. 15 is painted on reclaimed wood from a barn from early 1800's in Kentucky. A perfectly placed crack in the grain adds emphasis to the exploding lip.

This wood is white oak and has heavy circle saw marks from the original “circle saw” used to cut the wood into planks. Circle saws were used before the modern machinery we see today. Circle saw marks are a great way to test the antique age of a wood.

name: Wave No. 14
description:
14.5 x 30 Acrylic, ink on reclaimed white oak peppered wormwood.

Wave No. 14 has a gorgeous natural live bark edge trim along the base which uniquely sets this wave apart.  This reclaimed dairy barn wood dates from the 1890's from Michigan includes original paint artifacts which play nicely as dancing clouds above this peeling left.

name: Wave No. 13
description:
24 x 39 acrylic on reclaimed hickory wood

I had some friends recently return from a boat trip to the Mentawais. As I poured over their travel journal I couldn't get the image of gorgeous perfect right hand peelers out of my mind.  Some day I'll sell enough paintings to make the pilgramage to some of the best waves on the planet. In the mean time this rendition will have to satisfy.  

Wave No. 13 is painted on hickory and is reclaimed wood from a dairy barn in Nashville, Tennessee from the 1820's.  This is the same wood I sourced to paint Wave No. 4.

name: Wave No. 12
description:
11 x 22 Acrylic, ink on reclaimed white oak.

Wave No. 12 is painted on a piece of reclaimed dairy barn wood dating back to the 1890's from Michigan. The combination of wormwood and raised grain give this rifling left hand barrel a distinct look.  The original Milk paint provides a rich backdrop to this draining left hand barrel. Milk paint has been used for thousands of years and is made from milk and lime with or without pigments added for color.

name: Wave No. 11
description:
13.5 x 24 x 1.5 thick, acrylic, ink wash on reclaimed white oak.

Wave No. 11 is painted on a single slab of reclaimed wood from the 1890's from a barn in Michigan. Surfing calls to you and you go - no matter the weather, shape or size.

name: Wave No. 10
description: Acrylic and varnish on 100% recycled wood, sourced in the Ozarks. 41" long, 9" wide, and 3/8" thick This raw skate deck comes from the fine folks at Lavish Longboards. Check out lavishskate.com/ to pick up a skate.

name: Wave No. 9
description:
22 x 40 Acrylic, ink on reclaimed white oak.

Wave No. 9 is painted on two pieces of reclaimed wood from the 1890's from a barn in Michigan. The bottom piece shows the original circle saw marks used in planing the wood. The top piece of wood - the sky - has embedded vintage flat top nails and distressed memories.

name: Wave No. 8
description:
15x 30 Acrylic, ink on reclaimed white oak.

Wave No. 8 is painted on a piece of reclaimed dairy barn wood dating back to the 1890's from Michigan. The original Milk paint provides a rich backdrop to this draining left hand barrel. Milk paint has been used for thousands of years and is made from milk and lime with or without pigments added for color.    The green base piece of wood is from the same barn, but a separate section, the green is original paint from the barn.

name: Wave No. 5
description:
20 x 40 Acrylic on reclaimed wood, white oak

Wave No. 5 is painted on reclaimed wood from a barn from early 1800's in Kentuky. 

This wood is white oak and has heavy  circle saw marks from the original “circle saw” used to cut the wood into planks. Circle saws were used before the modern machinery we see today.  Circle saw marks are a great way to test the antique age of a wood.

name: Wave No. 7
description:
22x48 acrylic on maple

This is a wave in Indonesia from the perspective of the surfer. This view either makes you super nervous or super stoked or perhaps a bit of both.

name: Wave No. 4
description:
Sold to happy surfer in Mountain View, California.

25x40 acrylic on reclaimed hickory wood

Ocean Beach is a freight train of a wave.  The surfers who brave the frigid waters of San Francisco have my major respect.  Combine double overhead meaty beach break, with frigid take-your-breath away water and you have for one menacing spot.

Wave No. 4 is painted on hickory and is reclaimed wood from a dairy barn in Nashville, Tennessee from the 1820's.  This piece of wood has so much character and includes gorgeous aging and texture.

name: Wave No. 6
description:
12x24 fire, acrylic, ink on Maple

Indonesia has the most perfect waves on earth.  Also some of the most deadliest.

This was a mini version of the Wave No. 7.
